content: soap sack materials abbreviations u s terminology approx 20g of aran weight cotton chain chain 5mm hook slip_stitch slip_stitch scissors & yarn needle single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet the finished size should be approx 5 ins x 4 double_crochet double_crochet ins pattern foundation ring chain 4 slip_stitch into 1st chain to form a ring round 1 chain 2 counts as half_double_crochet 7 half_double_crochet into ring slip_stitch into 2nd chain at start to join 8 half_double_crochet round 2 chain 2 counts as half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in same stitch as join 2 half_double_crochet in each stitch around slip_stitch into 2nd chain at start to join 16 half_double_crochet round 3 chain 2 counts as half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in same stitch as join 1 half_double_crochet in next *2 half_double_crochet in next 1 half_double_crochet in next repeat from * to end slip_stitch into 2nd chain at start to join 24 half_double_crochet rounds 4-8 chain 2 1 double_crochet in same stitch as join and in each stitch around slip_stitch into the top of the first double_crochet to join 24 double_crochet round 9 chain 1 make 1 single_crochet in same stitch as join and in each stitch around slip_stitch into 1st single_crochet to join 24 single_crochet round 10 chain 2 1 double_crochet in same stitch as join and in each stitch around slip_stitch into the top of the first double_crochet to join 24 double_crochet round 11 chain 1 make 1 single_crochet in same stitch as join and in each stitch around slip_stitch into 1st single_crochet to join cut yarn and weave in ends to make drawstrings x 2 chain 40 weave one between the posts of the double_crochet in round 10 knot the ends together weave the second one the same way but from the opposite side of the bag knot the two ends together as well as using the drawstrings to close the soap bag they are handy for hanging it up too by ann cooke © craftedbyann
